title: Rob Gronkowski on his new CBD partnership, NFL future
text:
Football star Rob Gronkowski is partnering with Abacus Health (ABAHF), a publicly traded CBD company listed in Canada, the maker of CBDMEDIC.

“I’m an investor in CBDMedic,” Gronkowski told Yahoo Finance from the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. “It’s a topical cream with CBD in it — it has pharmaceutical grade ingredients.”

Gronkowski said his father introduced him to the cream, which aims to ease muscle pain.

Perry Antelman, CEO of Abacus Health Products, pointed to the cream’s potential benefits for football players dealing with pain from sports-related injuries. “It would be fabulous for the NFL,” Antelman said. “To be clear, this has no marijuana in it — this is a topical product, it does not go into the blood stream, there’s no THC and it is non-psychoactive.”

Gronkowski and Abacus Health will launch a suite of CBD products in early 2020, the company said.

Jan 31, 2019; Atlanta, GA, USA; New England Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski (87) addresses the media at a press conference for Super Bowl LIII at Hyatt Regency Atlanta. Mandatory Credit: Brett Davis-USA TODAY Sports More

Gronkowski retired earlier this year after a successful NFL career with the New England Patriots.

He remained coy when asked about a possible return to the NFL.

“To come back, they’re going to have to legalize CBD in the NFL,” he said. “No matter what I say, people are still going to say I’m coming back —so, I’m coming back, but I’m not.”
